description: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in OpenSSH version 8.2 when handling specially crafted authentication packets. This can lead to arbitrary code execution on the remote system.
A privilege escalation flaw was discovered in the sudo utility, allowing users with restricted access to gain root privileges due to a misconfiguration in sudoers policy parsing.
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.54, a race condition during connection teardown can result in use-after-free memory corruption, potentially leading to server crash or remote code execution.
